title: Scorpion
provenance_text:
Hans Jaenisch [1907-1989], Berlin-Charlottenburg, Germany, until December 1952 [1]; G. David Thompson [1899-1965], Pittsburgh, PA, December 1952 until March 1954 [2]; his gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, March 1954 [3].

Notes:
[1]. The painting was no. 127 in "The 1952 Pittsburgh International Exhibition of Contemporary Paintings" held at Carnegie Institute, October-December 1952.
[2]. Mr. Thompson purchased the painting from the International for $200. The artist cabled acceptance of the purchase on November 18, 1952 and payment (Mr. Thompson's check to the artist, dated December 8, 1952) was sent on December 11, 1952.
[3]. The painting was received at the museum on September 30, 1953; it was accessioned on March 3, 1954.
